content: And then just secondly, to put a finer point on Lisa's question, if you're doing $26 million EBITDA in the first half for your guidance, you've got to do $39 million in the second half to get to the midpoint of guidance, which means quarterly EBITDA has to move up towards almost $20 million a quarter, and just wanted to understand better what you thought the drivers of that were going to be, a little bit of that is revenue, but it really does look like the margin estimates or expectations have to be a fair amount higher in the second half.
